t: Isaiah 13
The*p burden of Babylon, which Isaiah the son of Amoz did see.
Lift*p ye up a banner upon the high mountain, exalt the voice unto them, shake the hand, that they may go into the gates of the nobles.
I*p have commanded my sanctified ones, I have also called my mighty ones for mine anger, even them that rejoice in my highness.
The*p noise of a multitude in the mountains, like as of a great people; a tumultuous noise of the kingdoms of nations gathered together: the Lord*s of hosts mustereth the host of the battle.
They*p come from a far country, from the end of heaven, even the Lord,*s and the weapons of his indignation, to destroy the whole land.
Howl*p ye; for the day of the Lord*s is at hand; it shall come as a destruction from the Almighty.
Therefore*p shall all hands be faint, and every man's heart shall melt:
And*p they shall be afraid: pangs and sorrows shall take hold of them; they shall be in pain as a woman that travaileth: they shall be amazed one at another; their faces shall be as flames.
Behold,*p the day of the Lord*s cometh, cruel both with wrath and fierce anger, to lay the land desolate: and he shall destroy the sinners thereof out of it.
For*p the stars of heaven and the constellations thereof shall not give their light: the sun shall be darkened in his going forth, and the moon shall not cause her light to shine.
And*p I will punish the world for their evil, and the wicked for their iniquity; and I will cause the arrogancy of the proud to cease, and will lay low the haughtiness of the terrible.
I*p will make a man more precious than fine gold; even a man than the golden wedge of Ophir.
Therefore*p I will shake the heavens, and the earth shall remove out of her place, in the wrath of the Lord*s of hosts, and in the day of his fierce anger.
And*p it shall be as the chased roe, and as a sheep that no man taketh up: they shall every man turn to his own people, and flee every one into his own land.
Every*p one that is found shall be thrust through; and every one that is joined unto them shall fall by the sword.
Their*p children also shall be dashed to pieces before their eyes; their houses shall be spoiled, and their wives ravished.
Behold,*p I will stir up the Medes against them, which shall not regard silver; and as for gold, they shall not delight in it.
Their*p bows also shall dash the young men to pieces; and they shall have no pity on the fruit of the womb; their eye shall not spare children.
And*p Babylon, the glory of kingdoms, the beauty of the Chaldeans' excellency, shall be as when God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah.
It*p shall never be inhabited, neither shall it be dwelt in from generation to generation: neither shall the Arabian pitch tent there; neither shall the shepherds make their fold there.
But*p wild beasts of the desert shall lie there; and their houses shall be full of doleful creatures; and owls shall dwell there, and satyrs shall dance there.
And*p the wild beasts of the islands shall cry in their desolate houses, and dragons in their pleasant palaces: and her time is near to come, and her days shall not be prolonged.
